title: 9.3.2 Rule import/export functionality
body:
## Parent Epic
Part of Epic 9: Advanced Security Scanning (#127)

## Objective
Enable users to import and export custom rules for sharing across teams, backup purposes, and community rule sharing.

## Requirements
- Export rules to YAML/JSON files
- Import rules from YAML/JSON files
- Validate imported rules before activation
- Support bulk import/export of multiple rules
- Handle rule conflicts during import (duplicate IDs)
- Provide rule sharing via URL or file
- Create rule packages (collection of related rules)
- Support versioning for imported rules
- Enable rule marketplace/community repository integration
- Track rule provenance (source, author, version)

## Features to Implement

### Export Features
- Export single rule to file
- Export multiple selected rules to file
- Export all rules to file (full backup)
- Export as YAML or JSON format
- Include rule metadata (author, version, created date)
- Option to include rule execution history

### Import Features
- Import single rule from file
- Import multiple rules from file (bulk import)
- Validate rule specification before import
- Handle duplicate rule IDs (skip, overwrite, rename options)
- Preview imported rules before activation
- Map imported rules to compliance frameworks
- Import from URL (shared rules)

### Rule Packages
- Create rule package with multiple related rules
- Package metadata (name, description, author, version)
- Package dependencies (if rules reference each other)
- Install/uninstall entire packages
- Update packages when new versions available

### Community Repository
- Submit rules to community repository
- Browse and search community rules
- Rate and review community rules
- Download popular community rules
- Track community rule usage statistics

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Export functionality implemented (single, multiple, all)
- [ ] Import functionality implemented with validation
- [ ] Conflict resolution options working (skip, overwrite, rename)
- [ ] Rule packages supported with metadata
- [ ] API endpoints for import/export operations
- [ ] UI for importing and exporting rules
- [ ] File format validation prevents malformed imports
- [ ] Preview mode shows imported rules before activation
- [ ] Community repository integration (optional Phase 3)
- [ ] Unit tests for import/export logic (>80% coverage)
- [ ] Integration test validates import/export round-trip
- [ ] Documentation includes import/export guide with examples
- [ ] Performance: Import 100 rules in <5 seconds

## File Format Example
```yaml
rule_package:
  name: "AWS Security Best Practices"
  description: "Common security rules for AWS resources"
  author: "Security Team"
  version: "1.0"
  rules:
    - id: custom-001
      name: "Require encryption for S3 buckets"
      # ... rule specification
    - id: custom-002
      name: "Enforce MFA for IAM users"
      # ... rule specification
```

## Technical Approach
- Use pyyaml library for YAML serialization
- JSON module for JSON serialization
- Schema validation using jsonschema
- Conflict resolution: Present options to user
- Package format: Wrapper around rule array with metadata
- Community repository: REST API integration (future phase)
- File upload: API endpoint with file size limits (<10MB)

## Security Considerations
- Validate file size limits (prevent DoS)
- Sanitize rule content during import
- Scan for malicious patterns in Python expressions
- Audit log all import operations
- Rate limit community repository submissions

## Estimated Effort
18-22 hours

## Dependencies
- Custom rule engine (issue 9.3.1)
- File upload infrastructure
- YAML/JSON parsing libraries
- Schema validation library
